{1: 'RImgBg1DisableSlow'}

{1: 'RImgBg1DisableSlow'}

{3: 'You and Liv came the entire way without breaking so much as a sweat...'}
{2: 'These are true eye-openers, Liv...', 3: '14'}
{3: 'The views around you seem to grow wilder still...'}
{3: 'The further into the forest you and Liv travel.'}
{3: 'With the views unfurling around both of you, Liv appears more embarrassed than nostalgic.'}
{3: 'She covers her now blushing face—yet her equally red ears give her away.'}
{3: 'When you and Liv reach an empty ground in the forest, you see a line of sheep lying on their side.'}
{3: 'So furry that their bodies take the shape of a ball, they are, to your surprise, amazingly agile.'}
{3: 'Right in the middle of the sheep is a saddle—and right when one of the sheep hops over the saddle...'}
{2: 'Sheep', 3: 'Baa!'}
{3: 'Then comes the next sheep...'}
{2: 'Sheep', 3: 'Baa! Baa!'}
{3: 'Then comes a third one...'}
{2: 'Sheep', 3: 'Baa! Baa! Baa!'}
{3: 'Eventually, all the baas turn into a light, rhythmic lullaby.'}
{2: 'I see you counted sheep in bed as a kid, huh?', 3: '36'}
{3: 'Liv slowly regains her composure as she looks nostalgically at the sheep.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I'd count them one at a time when I couldn't fall asleep.", 4: '1', 18: '100000518'}
{3: 'Liv says with a smile as she recalls her childhood.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "And sometimes I'd end up having even more trouble sleeping because I was so focused on counting them.", 4: '1', 18: '100000519'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Have you ever experienced it?', 4: '1', 18: '100000520'}
{3: "As a kid, you never had to do anything to have a good night's sleep because you always slept quite well."}
{3: 'But as an adult, you now spend more time trying to not fall asleep than coming up with ways to help yourself sleep.'}
{3: 'You actually did have to count to help yourself fall asleep as a kid, what with all the pent-up energy in you.'}
{3: 'But as an adult, you now spend more time trying to not fall asleep than coming up with ways to help yourself sleep.'}
{2: 'Why sheep, though?', 3: '52'}
{3: 'Everyone counts goats, no?'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Because sheep are cute.', 4: '1', 18: '100000521'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'I... actually am a big fan of sheep, and we even had sheep back home when I was a kid.', 4: '1', 18: '100000522'}
{3: 'You turn your gaze at the line of sheep—which stretches as far out as it possibly can along the horizon all the way from the west to the east.'}
{2: '(A real big fan... with a burning passion, too.)', 3: '60'}
{3: "You decide to keep these words to yourself so Liv wouldn't overheat from blushing."}
{3: 'You try to herd the sheep somewhere else—yet judging from the fact that none of them even bats an eye, you know your efforts are proving futile.'}
{3: "Unfortunately, it doesn't seem like you can move forward until you've figured out a different path."}
{2: 'And just look at this...', 3: '65'}
{3: 'Looking up, you see that the skies have gone from their previous white and blue to their current tangerine—a telltale sign that nightfall is fast approaching.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Should we find a place to rest for the day, Commandant?', 4: '1', 18: '100000523'}
{3: "While everything happening so far has taken place within the projection of a M.I.N.D. shard, you feel every bit as worn out as though you've been going through the day in the real world."}
{3: 'There is, in fact, another reason to your making this decision.'}
{2: "Well, it's not just because the sun is setting, though. See...", 3: '71'}
{2: "I'm sure you heard a lot of spooky stories as a kid, right?", 3: '72'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory536.jpg'}
{1: 'DialogEnable'}
{1: '1', 3: 'It listens, it chases, and it hunts…'}
{3: "It's the most feared predator in the dark forest, ready to prey on all souls alive."}
{3: "Listen—as its drool burns through the ground, having fallen from a mouth so big that it takes up over half of the monster's body."}
{3: 'Look—it will never let you go once it has its murderous eyes upon you.'}
{3: 'So run. Run as far as you can...'}
{3: "Until you've reached a place that can shelter you..."}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "I'm going to eat every last kid that refuses to sleep. Owooooo...!", 4: '1', 18: '100000675'}
{2: "(I thought it'd be something scarier.)", 3: '89', 4: "(Holy, that's creepy with a capital C!)", 5: '89'}
{3: 'To your surprise, however, the "predator" isn\'t some terrifying monster—rather, it\'s an adorable plushie.'}
{2: '???', 3: "I'm not scary at all, but I still eat kids who refuse to go to sleep. Owoooo...!", 4: '1', 18: '100000676'}
{3: 'Seeing the shark plushie leaving, you and Liv poke your heads out of the bushes.'}
{2: 'Was that something that scared you when you were a kid?', 3: '94'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Wait, did that happen to you, too?', 4: '1', 18: '100000524'}
{2: 'Well, sort of.', 3: '97', 4: "I've heard stories like that.", 5: '97'}
{3: "Monsters that claim to eat you up if you don't go to sleep on time, huh..."}
{3: "Seems like it's an all-time classic."}
{3: 'The only difference is that a scary monster is what you usually get in these stories rather than an adorable plushie.'}
{3: 'You approached it because it seemed harmless enough—except it put on a hostile front the moment it sensed your presence.'}
{2: "It wasn't scary at all, though.", 3: '103'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Are you talking about the plushie just now?', 4: '1', 18: '100000525'}
{3: 'Nodding your head, you start telling Liv about all the tricks the grown-ups used to fool you with from when you were a kid.'}
{2: '(Green octopus with a menacing face)', 3: '106', 4: '(Ball of fire that burns on and on)', 5: '106', 6: '(Muddy monster with eyes all over it)', 7: '106'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Did you ever feel scared?', 4: '1', 18: '100000526'}
{2: "I'd hide away under a blanket.", 3: '108', 4: 'I always felt okay when I turned on the light.', 5: '108', 6: "They ain't got nothing on me.", 7: '108'}
{3: 'Right then, you hear a voice coming from behind you—a voice that you know.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'There you are! Kids who refuse to go to sleep!', 18: '100000677'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryLineSpreadNew.prefab', 2: '1'}
{3: 'There is no point in turning around—because you know exactly where it is from its footsteps and shouts.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'I think we should split up, Commandant...', 4: '1', 18: '100000527'}
{3: 'Running away from the shark plushie, Liv once again makes the same suggestion.'}
{3: 'And once again, you turn down her suggestion.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "But I'm only dragging you down the way I am now.", 4: '1', 18: '100000528'}
{3: 'And you know exactly what Liv is talking about—her wings, with the fluorescence, make it almost too easy for the plushie to spot them in the dark.'}
{2: "We can't just keep running, though...", 3: '125'}
{3: 'Right then, something lands on your shoulder with a squeak.'}
{2: 'The chipmunk from before?', 3: '127'}
{3: "About to flick it off, you stop just in time. With the fluorescence coming off Liv's wings, you take a good look at the chipmunk."}
{3: "And that's when you see yet another chipmunk on Liv's shoulder."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Hurry up and hide yourselves... Where are you trying to take us?', 4: '1', 18: '100000529'}
{3: 'One of the chipmunks points its claw in a certain direction.'}
{1: 'RImgBg1BlowUp'}
{3: 'Nodding at each other, you and Liv run in the direction the chipmunk just pointed.'}

{2: 'This place seems safe.', 3: '145'}
{1: '1', 3: 'When you open the "door" of the shelter, Liv pokes her head out from the other side. You are now hiding with Liv inside two gigantic pea pods.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'How did the chipmunks find us, though?', 4: '1', 18: '100000530'}
{2: 'I... think they probably found us with the fluorescence coming off your wings.', 3: '149'}
{3: 'You point at the chipmunks, which are now chasing fireflies.'}
{3: "The fluorescence might be what's catching all the monsters' eyes in the dark, but it also stands as an inviting beacon to friends."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'What would you have done, though, if they had never shown up?', 4: '1', 18: '100000531'}
{2: 'I would have come up with something before we tired ourselves out.', 3: '153', 4: "I've got plan B.", 5: '153', 6: 'I would have fought back.', 7: '153'}
{3: 'Without saying anything, Liv changes the subject somewhat awkwardly.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'This place seems perfect for rest.', 4: '1', 18: '100000533'}
{2: 'Yup. You should get some rest, too, Liv.', 3: '158'}
{2: "Correct me if I'm wrong, but...", 3: '161'}
{2: "You're supposed to rest on time as part of the rehabilitation process for your M.I.N.D., right?", 3: '162'}
{3: 'You cut Liv off before she finishes speaking.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I can't just rest whenever I want to inside my M.I.N.D...", 4: '1', 18: '100000535'}
{3: 'The opening on the pea pod that Liv is in faces that of yours. Lying down, she meets you in the eye.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "But I'll still try to get some sleep, Commandant.", 4: '1', 18: '100000536'}
{3: "The moonlight is cold and anything but bright, but it shows you perfectly in Liv's eyes."}
{2: '(Refuse to look away)', 3: '170', 4: '(Close eyes)', 5: '195'}
{3: 'You don\'t want to look away—because you know that the moment you do, you lose this "game."'}
{3: "Besides, you and Liv are already used to being around each other, having been through all that you've been through together over the years."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Having a hard time falling asleep, Commandant?', 4: '1', 18: '100000537'}
{2: 'Never had an easy time falling asleep away from home.', 3: '174'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'But you fell asleep in the crater in that mission we went on together.', 4: '1', 18: '100000538'}
{2: 'Oh, I remember that mission...', 3: '176'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory60.jpg'}
{3: "You actually don't usually get to sleep in your own bed because of all sorts of accidents."}
{3: 'Ruins that can only block off the wind, tight craters, and abandoned cars—these are the kind of places you usually find yourself sleeping at.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory300.png'}
{1: '1', 3: "The pea pod you're in proves to be a lot more comfortable, except..."}
{2: "It's got nothing to do with this place.", 3: '188'}
{2: 'And you? Still trying to get used to this place?', 3: '189'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I haven't recalled a thing, but I find this place familiar and am very used to it.", 4: '1', 18: '100000539'}
{2: "That's fine. I'm sure you'll remember everything...", 3: '191'}
{2: 'When we find the M.I.N.D. shard.', 3: '192'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Yup... So, what was your childhood like, Commandant?', 4: '1', 18: '100000540'}
{3: 'Following the course of the subject, Liv asks you curiously.'}
{3: "Her eyes are as gentle as they've always been—yet at this very moment, you can feel a certain feeling bubbling up from deep within you."}
{2: 'You need to close your eyes before you can fall asleep.', 3: '198'}
{3: "Apparently picking up on your uneasiness, Liv closes her eyes like a good kid. With her stare gone, all that's left around you is the quiet air."}
{3: 'Then, a few moments later, Liv asks you quietly.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Having a hard time falling asleep, Commandant?', 4: '1', 18: '100000542'}
{2: 'I have never for the life of me dreamed of sleeping in the forest of a fairytale.', 3: '207'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'The forest of a fairytale, huh... So, what was your childhood like, Commandant?', 4: '1', 18: '100000543'}
{3: "Liv's curious voice lingers by your ears."}
{2: '(Tell her everything about your childhood)', 3: '211', 4: '(Tell her about part of your childhood)', 5: '212', 6: '(Make something up)', 7: '213'}

{3: "You don't remember ever telling anyone about your childhood since you rarely ever even talk about your life before coming to Gray Raven. You decide to take advantage of this chance to have a good chat with Liv."}
{3: "You can't be 100% sure whether all the things you believe are part of your childhood are really part of your childhood, so you decide to go with what you're more certain of."}
{3: "You wouldn't really classify yourself as a well-behaved child... Wanting to maintain your image, you decide to make something up."}
{3: 'Liv listens quietly for the most part, but she would still raise questions every now and then—which, to your surprise, actually helps you recall a big chunk of your long-forgotten memory.'}
{3: 'And with it, the conversation went from a monologue to a dialogue, with no end in sight.'}

{3: 'Your surroundings fall quieter still as time passes. The cries of the insects—loud and clear until just moments ago—have all died down, too. The two of you grow sleepy as you carry on chitchatting in the dark.'}
{3: 'Time goes by a mile a second as you laugh and chat away—and you know you both are feeling the right amount of sleepiness to sleep now.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I'd love to learn more about you, Commandant... but I guess it's time for bed.", 4: '1', 18: '100000544'}
{3: "Liv's voice grows distant as you grow drowsy."}
{2: 'Tell me about yourself next time, Liv.', 3: '224'}
{3: 'The words coming out of your mouth are garbled up.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Me...? I barely remember anything, though, and the things I do still remember... probably aren't too interesting at all.", 4: '1', 18: '100000545'}
{2: "Well, everything we've seen so far in here...", 3: '229'}
{3: "You need no further proof—because the place you're about to fall asleep at is none other than Liv's childhood itself."}
{2: 'Seems to say otherwise...', 3: '231'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '5'}
{3: '"I\'ll make sure to find it for you. Tell me more about yourself when I\'ve found it."'}
{3: "You don't remember if you actually said these words before falling asleep."}

{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'Hey... Good morning. Did you have some quality rest?', 4: '1', 18: '100000681'}
{3: "A woman you've never seen before stands in the hallway with a wooden tray. Initially caught by surprise, she quickly regains her gentle smile."}
{3: "Your hunch is that she doesn't intend to hurt you—and hunches are often the most reliable in M.I.N.D."}
{2: "Hi. What's your name?", 3: '343'}
{2: 'I was with a friend just now...', 3: '345'}
{2: 'Does she happen to be here, too?', 3: '346'}
{2: 'Cinderella', 3: "The young lady, right? She's in the room right across.", 4: '1', 18: '100000683'}
{3: 'Cinderella knocks on the door but receives no response.'}
{2: 'Liv, are you in there?', 3: '350'}
{3: 'Cinderella knocks on the door harder still but still gets no response.'}
{2: 'Cinderella', 3: 'Is she the type that struggles to wake up?', 4: '1', 18: '100000684'}

{3: 'Seeing you shake your head, Cinderella hesitates for a moment before she opens the door.'}
{3: 'The set-up of the room is basically the same as the one you woke up in. Liv lies in the bed with her back facing you, apparently still asleep.'}
{3: "You can't see her face, but you can tell from the groan that she's in pain."}

{3: "You're no stranger to what's happening—this is a symptom of Liv's migraine. Out of habit, you want to take out your connecting cable for Deep M.I.N.D. connection, but it hits you that you already are in Liv's M.I.N.D."}
{3: "Setting her tray on the table, Cinderella dashes up to Liv's bed."}
{3: "She holds Liv's face with her hands as she presses her head against Liv's, all the while mumbling something unintelligible."}
{3: "And with it, as a faint fluorescence envelopes them, Liv's face softens."}
{3: "A few moments later, Cinderella puts Liv's head back on the pillow ever so gently."}
{3: 'Cinderella stands up, looking slightly out of it.'}
{2: 'Are you okay?', 3: '378'}
{2: 'Cinderella', 3: "I'm fine. I was just a bit out of it.", 4: '1', 18: '100000686'}
{3: 'Cinderella quickly regains her composure. Then, you see Liv slowly sit up.'}
{2: 'Cinderella', 3: 'Feel free to call me Cinderella, Liv.', 4: '2', 18: '100000687'}
{3: 'Cinderella is now looking at you and Liv with her gentle eyes—eyes that now seem even more loving than they did before.'}
{3: 'You quickly fill Liv in on what happened just now.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Thank you so much, Ms. Cinderella.', 4: '1', 18: '100000547'}
{2: 'Cinderella', 3: "Don't mention it, and feel free to just call me Cinderella.", 4: '2', 18: '100000688'}
{1: '1', 3: 'With a gentle, accepting smile, Cinderella turns this way.'}
{2: 'Cinderella', 3: "You're both now safe, and I bet you must be hungry. How about a bowl of bean soup?", 4: '1', 18: '100000689'}
{3: 'Pointing at the tray sitting on the table, she seems to be waiting for a favorable response.'}
{3: 'The steaming creamy green soup has diced onions, carrots, and round peas floating on its surface.'}
{3: 'The fresh veggies and the aroma of butter make for a temptation impossible to resist.'}
{2: 'Yes, of course!', 3: '404', 4: "No, I'm actually not...", 5: '409'}
{3: "Given that she just helped stabilize Liv, you don't think there is anything to worry about the food she's prepared."}
{3: "And from her eyes, you're sensing a very special quality..."}
{3: 'That you\'d probably describe as "motherliness."'}
{3: "Which is why you don't think it's a good idea to turn her down."}
{2: 'Cinderella', 3: 'Right, you probably still have trouble eating on your own, right?', 4: '1', 18: '100000690'}
{2: 'Cinderella', 3: 'Let me feed you, then.', 4: '1', 18: '100000691'}
{3: "And with it, she approaches you with the bowl and spoon. She's still gentle and all, but it doesn't seem like she's going to take no for an answer."}
